013package org.apache.juneau.rest.beans;
014
015import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
016import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
017import org.apache.juneau.html.annotation.*;
018import org.apache.juneau.http.annotation.*;
019
020/**
021 * Shortcut label for child resources.
022 *
023 * <p>
024 * Typically used in router resources.
025 *
026 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
027 * <p class='bjava'>
028 *    <jk>new</jk> ResourceDescription(<js>"httpTool"</js>, <js>"HTTP request test client"</js>);
029 * </p>
030 *
031 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
032 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/UtilityBeans">Utility Beans</a>
033
034 * </ul>
035 */
036@Bean(properties="name,description", findFluentSetters=true)
037@Response(schema=@Schema(ignore=true))
038public class ResourceDescription implements Comparable<ResourceDescription> {
039
040   private String name, uri, description;
041
042   /**
043    * Constructor for when the name and uri are the same.
044    *
045    * @param name The name of the child resource.
046    * @param description The description of the child resource.
047    */
048   public ResourceDescription(String name, String description) {
049      this.name = name;
050      this.uri = name;
051      this.description = description;
052   }
053
054   /**
055    * Constructor for when the name and uri are different.
056    *
057    * @param name The name of the child resource.
058    * @param uri The uri of the child resource.
059    * @param description The description of the child resource.
060    */
061   public ResourceDescription(String name, String uri, String description) {
062      this.name = name;
063      this.uri = uri;
064      this.description = description;
065   }
066
067   /** No-arg constructor.  Used for JUnit testing of OPTIONS pages. */
068   public ResourceDescription() {}
069
070   /**
071    * Returns the name field on this label.
072    *
073    * @return The name.
074    */
075   @Html(link="servlet:/{uri}")
076   public String getName() {
077      return name;
078   }
079
080   /**
081    * Returns the uri on this label.
082    *
083    * @return The name.
084    */
085   public String getUri() {
086      return uri == null ? name : uri;
087   }
088
089   /**
090    * Sets the name field on this label to a new value.
091    *
092    * @param name The new name.
093    * @return This object.
094    */
095   public ResourceDescription name(String name) {
096      this.name = name;
097      return this;
098   }
099
100   /**
101    * Returns the description field on this label.
102    *
103    * @return The description.
104    */
105   public String getDescription() {
106      return description;
107   }
108
109   /**
110    * Sets the description field on this label to a new value.
111    *
112    * @param description The new description.
113    * @return This object.
114    */
115   public ResourceDescription description(String description) {
116      this.description = description;
117      return this;
118   }
119
120   /**
121    * Sets the uri field on this label to a new value.
122    *
123    * @param uri The new uri.
124    * @return This object.
125    */
126   public ResourceDescription uri(String uri) {
127      this.uri = uri;
128      return this;
129   }
130
131   @Override /* Comparable */
132   public int compareTo(ResourceDescription o) {
133      return getName().toString().compareTo(o.getName().toString());
134   }
135
136   @Override /* Object */
137   public boolean equals(Object o) {
138      return (o instanceof ResourceDescription) && Utils.eq(this, (ResourceDescription)o, (x,y)->Utils.eq(x.getName(), y.getName()));
139   }
140
141   @Override /* Object */
142   public int hashCode() {
143      return getName().hashCode();
144   }
145}
